51-year-old.context: This is a 51-year-old gentleman here with his wife.

loud snoring.context: She confirms the history of loud snoring at night with witnessed apnea.

witnessed apnea.context: She confirms the history of loud snoring at night with witnessed apnea.

moderate sleep apnea.context: The result of the sleep study was reviewed. This showed moderate sleep apnea with significant desaturation.

significant desaturation.context: The result of the sleep study was reviewed. This showed moderate sleep apnea with significant desaturation.

CPAP.context: The patient was unable to tolerate treatment with CPAP.

large tonsils.context: At the office, we observed large tonsils and elongation and thickening of the uvula as well as redundant soft tissue of the palate.

elongation and thickening of the uvula.context: At the office, we observed large tonsils and elongation and thickening of the uvula as well as redundant soft tissue of the palate.

redundant soft tissue of the palate.context: At the office, we observed large tonsils and elongation and thickening of the uvula as well as redundant soft tissue of the palate.

tortuous appearance of the septum.context: At the office, we observed large tonsils and elongation and thickening of the uvula as well as redundant soft tissue of the palate. A tortuous appearance of the septum also was observed.

sinus infections.context: He has no history of sinus infections and does not recall a history of nasal trauma.

nasal trauma.context: He has no history of sinus infections and does not recall a history of nasal trauma.

tonsillectomy.context: Tonsillectomy, uvulopalatopharyngoplasty, and septoplasty for obstructive sleep apnea syndrome with hypertrophy of tonsils and of uvula and soft palate with deviation of nasal septum

uvulopalatopharyngoplasty.context: Tonsillectomy, uvulopalatopharyngoplasty, and septoplasty for obstructive sleep apnea syndrome with hypertrophy of tonsils and of uvula and soft palate with deviation of nasal septum

septoplasty.context: Tonsillectomy, uvulopalatopharyngoplasty, and septoplasty for obstructive sleep apnea syndrome with hypertrophy of tonsils and of uvula and soft palate with deviation of nasal septum

Afrin drops.context: Afrin drops were placed in both nostrils and a cottonoid soaked with Afrin was placed in each side of the nose.

Crowe-Davis mouth gag.context: A Crowe-Davis mouth gag was placed.

Marcaine.context: The tonsil fossae were injected with 0.25% Marcaine with 1:200,000 epinephrine.

epinephrine.context: The tonsil fossae were injected with 0.25% Marcaine with 1:200,000 epinephrine.

Alice clamp.context: The uvula was grasped with the Alice clamp.

Bayonet cautery.context: We switched over from the Bayonet cautery to the blunt needle tip electrocautery.

blunt needle tip electrocautery.context: We switched over from the Bayonet cautery to the blunt needle tip electrocautery.

chromic catgut sutures.context: The posterior soft palate mucosa was advanced forward and brought up to the anterior soft palate incision and closure of the soft palate wound was then accomplished with interrupted 3-0 chromic catgut sutures.

Freer elevator.context: Mucoperichondrium and mucoperiosteum were elevated with the Cottle elevator. When we reached the deflected portion of the vomer, this was separated from the septal cartilage with a Freer elevator.

Cottle elevator.context: Mucoperichondrium and mucoperiosteum were elevated with the Cottle elevator. When we reached the deflected portion of the vomer, this was separated from the septal cartilage with a Freer elevator.

4 mm osteotome.context: When we reached the deflected portion of the vomer, this was separated from the septal cartilage with a Freer elevator. The right-sided mucoperiosteum was elevated with the Freer elevator and then with Takahashi forceps and with the 4 mm osteotome, the deflected portion of the septal bone from the vomer was resected.

Takahashi forceps.context: When we reached the deflected portion of the vomer, this was separated from the septal cartilage with a Freer elevator. The right-sided mucoperiosteum was elevated with the Freer elevator and then with Takahashi forceps and with the 4 mm osteotome, the deflected portion of the septal bone from the vomer was resected.

knife handle.context: The inferior turbinates were then both outfractured using a knife handle

Polysporin ointment.context: Polysporin ointment was introduced into both nostrils.
